result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Robert William Klepach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

16A 003565/reversed to fix.  Clarification by Clerk:  $17.50 was ordered as RESTITUTION.

Defendant Robert William Klepach in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court, court finds the agreement is fulfilled.  Defendant is awarded with a Certificate and a medallion of completion of Veterans Treatment Initiative.


Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional Statements by:  KRISTINE K.

AS TO COUNT 2:

On motion of the State,  Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced defendant to serve  THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT TO SAUK COUNTY CASE 14CM427.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of THREE HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($350.00) plus costs, penalties and surcharges by 01-27-2018 or a civil judgment will be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for TWELVE (12) MONTHS.  Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of TWELVE (12)
MONTHS.

* Restitution payable to WEST ALLIS POLICE DEPARTMENT for SEVENTEEN DOLLARS AND FIFTY CENTS ($17.50) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Filed, sdg.

VETERAN COURT
Review hearing proceeded.  Court held colluquy with the defendant.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court DPA matter adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Court orders a No VIOLENT contact order.

Defendant Robert William Klepach in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, and Addendum, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction AS TO COUNT 1, and WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction AS TO COUNT 2.  Early Intervention Program VTI Deferred Sentencing Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Robert William Klepach in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel continues to work on getting this case transferred to Veteran's Court.  Court has no objection to this case being transferred, if accepted.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court, defendant Robert William Klepach not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kristine K

Defendant Robert William Klepach in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Robert William Klepach in custody.  George David Kidd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
